section.title: Project Files
section.para: This window is displayed automatically when OmegaT loads a project, and at any time by using in the menu.
The window displays the following information:

listitem.para: the total number of translatable files in the project. These are the files present in the folder in a format that OmegaT is able to recognize. This number is displayed between parenthesis, in the window title,
the list of all translatable files in the project.
File entries include their names, file filter types, their encoding and the number of segments each file contains
the total number of segments, the number of unique segments in the whole project, and the number of unique segments already translated are shown at the bottom

section.para:
You can:
click on any file to open it for translation in the ,
select a file with Up and Down,
type a string to filter the list on the files that contain the string in their name,
sort the files by clicking on any of the 5 headers,
change the position of one or more files in the list by selecting them and using the Move buttons on the right,
Right-click on a filename to open a contextual menu from which you can open the source file and (if it exists) the target file,
CRight-click to open their location.
The number of unique segments is computed by taking all the segments and removing all duplicate segments.

warning.para: Modifying the segmentation rules will modify the number of segments/unique segments.

section.para: The difference between "Number of segments" and "Number of unique segments" provides an approximate idea of the number of repetitions in the text. The located in the folder of your project contains more detailed segment information, broken down by file.
The Copy Files To Source Folder and the Download Mediawiki Page buttons have the same effect as the equivalent item in the menu.

note.para: It is possible to inhibit the window displaying at opening, by setting the project_files_show_on_load option to false in .
